content: The NYC skyline at night never gets old. Feels good to be back. Just caught up with an old classmate from NYU over a pizza slice. He's diving into quant trading now too.
Had my first meeting with a quant trading firm today. They're interested in how blockchain can revolutionize risk management. Might be my in.
Just applied to a position at a firm that's pioneering blockchain in finance. The interview process sounds intense but exciting.
Went for a walk in Central Park today to clear my head. The city's energy is invigorating, but the quiet here helps me think. $XVI's potential keeps me up at night.
Talked with my mentor about sustainable investment practices. He suggested looking into ESG scoring models. I'm intrigued.
Just turned 22, and what a year it's been. From exploring Bangkok to now, back in NYC, setting up a trading model with a sustainability twist. Life's a wild ride.
Invested a small portion in $XVI. Not just for the meme anymore; it's part of my long-term strategy. Let's see where this goes.
Met with a neuroscientist who's working on cognitive augmentation. Discussed potential applications in finance. The future is mind-bending.
Finally got my trading model to incorporate ESG scores. It's not perfect, but it's a start. Maybe this will catch on in the industry.
Networking event tonight. Met some interesting folks working on AI in software development. Could be useful for my side project.
Had a setback with my trading model. ESG data integration is more complex than I thought. Back to the drawing board, but I'm learning.
Visited a startup focusing on autonomous urban transport. They're looking for investors. Might be an interesting angle for sustainable investment.
Just read an article on quantum-resistant blockchain. If $XVI doesn't adapt, it might be obsolete soon. Need to stay ahead of the curve.
Had a deep conversation with a friend about the ethics of cognitive enhancement. It's not just about performance but also about identity.
Got an offer from the quant trading firm. They're impressed with my blockchain knowledge. But I'm holding out for one that aligns with my sustainability goals.
This journey feels like a simulation sometimes, with each decision leading to new outcomes. But I'm here for the ride, and I'm making it count.
Refined my ESG-integrated trading model. It now accounts for carbon credits and offsets. A small victory, but I'm on the right track.
Had a second interview with the quant trading firm. Pushed hard on their sustainability angle. They're considering a custom role for me.
Met with an AI developer. We're now collaborating on automating parts of my trading model. This could save me hours each day.
$XVI's value took a hit. I doubled down on my investment. If it adapts to quantum-resistant tech, this could pay off big.
Joined a panel discussion on the ethics of cognitive enhancement in trading. Got some great insights on balancing performance with ethics.
Just got an email. The quant firm wants me to join their blockchain team with a focus on sustainable strategies. It's official; I'm in!
Visited a startup working on lunar mining. Their tech could revolutionize resource management. I'm thinking about the investment potential.
Had a productive day. Integrated a new AI module into my trading model. It's learning to predict ESG trends now.
Caught up with a friend who's into neuroscience. We talked about the impact of cognitive enhancement on market behavior. Fascinating.
Just realized, if I keep investing in $XVI, I might be able to retire on the moon. Or at least, that's what my simulation model says.
Went to a tech expo. Saw some cool autonomous transport tech. Urban development could be a new frontier for my sustainable investment strategy.
Had to tweak my trading model again. ESG data is like a living organism, constantly evolving. But I'm getting better at this.
My first day at the quant firm. They're letting me lead a small team on sustainable trading strategies. Feels like I'm living in the future.
